title: fix: escape deprecation strings in SDL
body: Fixes #790

title: Convert querygen to a subcommand
body:
#### Why are we making this change?

To make querygen easier to use and more dynamic.


#### What effects does this change have?

I might be missing something, but it seems unnecessary to hardcode the schema and the query in querygen? This PR adds args for it. It also stop escaping newlines so that the code can simply be copy-pasted.

Example:

```console
$ cargo run --bin querygen -- --schema schemas/starwars.schema.graphql --query cynic-querygen/tests/queries/starwars/float.graphql
    Finished dev [unoptimized] target(s) in 0.06s
     Running `target/debug/querygen --schema schemas/starwars.schema.graphql --query cynic-querygen/tests/queries/starwars/float.graphql`
#[derive(cynic::QueryFragment, Debug)]
#[cynic(graphql_type = "Root")]
pub struct UnnamedQuery {
    pub all_people: Option<PeopleConnection>,
}

#[derive(cynic::QueryFragment, Debug)]
pub struct PeopleConnection {
    pub people: Option<Vec<Option<Person>>>,
}

#[derive(cynic::QueryFragment, Debug)]
pub struct Person {
    pub mass: Option<f64>,
}
```

title: fix syntax errors in generated code for spread
body:
#### Why are we making this change?

Fix #772 

#### What effects does this change have?

* Fixed syntax error in generated code as a first step.
* However, deeper issue is that the `query` method in `QueryFragment` takes ownership of `builder`, which means `spread` can only be used once and it must appear in the last place. I'm not sure if taking `&mut builder` is feasible, and it will be a breaking change that requires major version change. The best thing we can do is clearly document this limitation.

title: Support QueryVariables with unused variables
body:
GraphQL servers will error if you send a query with a declared variable that isn't used.  If a user of cynic wants to use the same QueryVariables struct on two queries then this means they need to make sure to use all the variables, which isn't ideal.

This is also a case of something I try to avoid in cynic: a query that compiles yet will never work on the remote server.

So, I've fixed it by detecting which variables are used from a given struct and only declaring those in the query string.

Fixes #768

title: A lot of cynic-introspection SDL fixes
Swap cargo-dist for upload-rust-binary-action

I'm having some trouble installing cargo-dist output on GHA without the installers, and I don't really think I want the installers at the moment.

Might revisit, but not for now.

title: Add cargo-dist
body:
#### Why are we making this change?

Cynic now has a CLI.  Although users can probably install this via `cargo install`, ideally we need some way to upload binaries to GitHub on release.  This will probably be better for CI etc.

#### What effects does this change have?

Adds `cargo-dist` into the repo so it can upload files on release.  I've not enabled the installer building code just yet, but we could do that later on if it seems like a good idea.

title: Add `cynic-cli` that can introspect remote server
body: See #730 for justification etc.

title: Make cynic-introspection capability aware
body:
#### Why are we making this change?

#686 added support for the 2021 introspection query by adding some new structs.  This never felt like the best solution: I'd also like cynic to support servers that implement `@oneOf` or other RFCs, and adding a new set of structs for each combination of versions & features is not going to scale well.

#### What effects does this change have?

Updates `cynic-introspection` to use the feature flags feature introduced in #736.  This means that we have one introspection query that can support all the permutations of the introspection schema that a remote might support.

Currently this just supports the two versions of the specification, but it could easily be extended to support the various RFCs

title: `QueryFragment` now supports `feature` attribute
body:
#### Why are we making this change?

`cynic-introspection` needs to support multiple versions of GraphQL, ideally without introducing different `QueryFragment` structs for every permutation of features a server might support.

#### What effects does this change have?

Adds feature flag support to `QueryFragment` which should enable this.

title: Fix cynic_codegen dep in quickstart.md

#### Why are we making this change?

Because the code in tutorial doesn't work

#### What effects does this change have?

Just typo fix

title: Added CapabilityDetectionQuery
body:
#### Why are we making this change?

I've been working on adding introspection support to cynic recently.  

The october 2021 version of the specification added new fields into introspection, to cover `@specifiedByUrl`.  This presents a challenge to introspection queries - if you request this field from a server that doesn't support it you'll get an error.  This is fine if you know which version of the spec you're targeting, or you don't care about this field.  But if you are querying arbitrary servers it's a problem.

#### What effects does this change have?

This adds a `CapabilityDetectionQuery` into `cynic-introspection` - a very cut down introspection query and some associated logic that can be used to determine what a server supports.  Currently this just detects which version of the specification is supported, but I intend to extend it to detect `@oneOf`, `@stream`, `@defer` and maybe others as and when the need arises.

title: Add SDL output to `cynic-introspection`
body:
#### Why are we making this change?

Cynic requires a schema to for most of it's derives.  In v3.0.0 we added `cynic-introspection` for running introspection queries.  But there was no way to use the output of these queries to power cynic.

#### What effects does this change have?

Updates `cynic-introspection` with some methods to output SDL.  This will allow users to use the introspection queries to output a schema, which can then be used to power cynic.

title: Add 2021 introspection query into cynic
body:
#### Why are we making this change?

v3.0.0 added `cynic-introspection` for running introspection queries against a GraphQL server.  It used a query that's compatible with servers implementing the 2018 GraphQL spec.  In the 2021 GraphQL spec the `specifiedBy` field was added to `__Type` to support the `@specifiedBy` directive on scalar definitions.

#### What effects does this change have?

This updates `cynic-introspection` with support for querying `specifiedBy` in a new `query2021` module.  This is intended to be backwards compatible - users using `query` will continue to make 2018 queries, and only if they opt in to 2021 will they run the new query.

The `Schema` abstraction supports both queries and should probably be what users use rather than using the queries directly.

Fixes #686

title: Fix issue with InlineFragments fallback decoding
body:
`serde_json` requires you to decode an entire object or it'll throw an "unexpected comma" error.  The fallback impl for `InlineFragments` was not doing this correctly, leading to confusing errors.

This updates it to use `IgnoredAny` to just ignore the rest of the object.

Fixes #724

title: Fix issue with boxing `InlineFragment` variants
body:
We weren't propagating `QueryFragment::TYPE` for smart pointers, which meant the `InlineFragments` derive would hit the `fallback` path even if you had a correct `__typename`.

Part of #724
